text: .@POTUS is exactly right. Putin only understands pure military strength and economic pain. President Trump and I believe Ukraine can win – a fact President Biden avoided saying for years. It is time to ramp up pressure on Putin to end this senseless bloodshed.

Happy birthday @narendramodi! Congratulations on many years of public service and global leadership. You have a lot of friends in the State of Mississippi. I look forward to continued partnership between India and the United States.
I met with the Mississippi Bankers Association to discuss how Community Development Financial Institutions can support small businesses and create jobs for Mississippians. https://t.co/IVmNuuDPpH

24 years ago today, I attended a meeting in the Pentagon just before it was struck by terrorists. As Americans honor the memory of those we lost on 9/11, we must remain vigilant. We must recommit to defending the homeland against today’s threats.
Join me in praying for Charlie Kirk. Political violence has no place in the United States.

I am honored to be recognized by the Speak Foundation, which has tirelessly advocated for those living with LGMD. As the chairman of the Rare Disease Caucus, I will never stop supporting new treatments, research, and clinical trials for patients facing uncommon illnesses. https://t.co/AUhP1reWDB

.@SenHydeSmith and I wholeheartedly support the confirmation of Mississippi Supreme Court Justices Maxwell and Chamberlin to the U.S. District Court. Today, we spoke at their confirmation hearing and we look forward to their swift confirmation. https://t.co/0SLBaK9aOL

Twenty years ago today, Hurricane Katrina made landfall in Mississippi. We all remember the flattened homes, businesses, and schools, as well as the years we devoted to recovery. We have come so far. Today, the Gulf Coast is a bustling hub of commerce, innovation, and tourism. We will continue looking forward to the bright future of our coast and state.
https://t.co/WrYhsVs0le

The Taiwanese people and their resolve to live in a free society are a symbol of hope for the world. 

I’m glad to be here and to stand shoulder to shoulder with the free people of Taiwan as we work together to enhance their right to self-determination.

Gayle and I had a wonderful time at the USO getting to know our service members stationed in Guam. 

Thank you to all of our men and women in uniform and to these great Mississippians who we were honored to meet! https://t.co/ztbZio1JZD

The Pearl River flood control project is a prime example of how federal bureaucracy fails Americans. Under this administration, we have the opportunity to end the 45-year stalemate. 

It's time to let Jackson build. https://t.co/oiaRQ6er19
The Mardi Gras Service will increase tourism and job creation across Mississippi. The inaugural ride was only the beginning of what's to come for the Mississippi Gulf Coast. https://t.co/NMA2ULMsdX
Today, we celebrate Ukraine’s Independence Day. The U.S. stands with the Ukrainian people as they fight to maintain their freedom, democracy, and sovereignty.

On the first day of our CODEL, @SenatorFischer and I held a productive and insightful slate of meetings with the Commanders of INDOPACOM, MARFORPAC, USARPAC, & PACAF to discuss the challenges their forces face in the region. https://t.co/JxNA6taeLt

Congratulations to our own Rachel McAlpin on her 50m breaststroke world junior title in her international debut! You represented Mississippi on the world stage and we are excited to see all you will accomplish in the future.

President @realDonaldTrump, your advocate, Mark Levin, warns that Vladimir Putin is a "genocidal maniac." 

These are wise words from a good friend. Putin lies and kills. Your leadership will be key to keep Ukraine, U.S., and Europe together against Putin's delays and deceptions.
After 20 years, passenger rail has officially returned to the Mississippi Gulf Coast. All aboard!
What an incredible day! @Amtrak Mardi Gras rail is one of the last pieces of the puzzle to rebuild from Hurricane Katrina. All aboard! https://t.co/x3RexHU5y1
The end of the Mardi Gras Service is in Mobile, Alabama. It was great to join the people of Mobile for a wonderful celebration of the Gulf Coast! https://t.co/wKkzcXFS4T
Pascagoula is the last Mississippi stop on the Mardi Gras rail. It's been a great day on the Amtrak train! https://t.co/Fr104IuHVR
Thanks for having us, Biloxi! https://t.co/oTI3h7eKD0
The Mardi Gras train was early to our stop in Gulfport! This on-time train will bring more jobs and tourists to the Gulf Coast. https://t.co/3erF3ie1bL
A warm welcome from Bay St. Louis to Amtrak! https://t.co/hl0NTrWkXA
The Inaugural @Amtrak Mardi Gras train ride has begun. Next stop, Mississippi! https://t.co/7xHouNWG69

It was great to join Commissioner Trusty on her first official visit as @FCC commissioner! Better internet connectivity directly translates into economic success and better telehealth options. I look forward to working with Commissioner Trusty to deliver results for MS. https://t.co/zjdy5oA0wD

I spoke at the ribbon cutting of the expansion of the Solid Rocket Complex with @anduriltech. This expansion will create more jobs while building up our national defense. This expansion will strengthen our military as it prepares to meet the threats we face today. https://t.co/cnFNz7XaVa

I was glad to be the keynote speaker at the Gulfport Chamber of Commerce yesterday. I highlighted how the reconciliation bill cuts taxes for job creators and how the opening of the Mardi Gras Rail will grow economic development in MS. Thank you for having me! https://t.co/V3Hj7hmRi3

I joined @MGCCC in the opening of their Defense Industry Training Accelerated Courses Facility. Mississippians are stepping up to rebuild our national defense, and this program will equip them for that task. https://t.co/m7KQpnnV8Y

I'm glad to see Ukraine's anti-corruption agencies will remain independent. Ukraine's fight for freedom relies on the strength of its democracy. I continue to stand with Ukraine in their fight for independence. https://t.co/bDyJqDqUCd

I am excited to announce that @USDOT has awarded over $21 million to Simpson county! This funding will help construct two bridges that will improve the flow of traffic and interstate commerce. Learn more about the BUILD grants below. https://t.co/P3jIgAAZHp

.@SecDef's memo is a thoughtful, aggressive step forward for small drone fielding. 

In concert with the #FY26NDAA FORGED Act and the $2B+ for small drones in @POTUS #OBBB, we are going to rapidly build a world-leading American small drone industry.
Many thanks to POTUS for these new efforts to fight against Putin's aggression and move toward a successful conclusion to the war. https://t.co/KXLKtaqnI7
This brilliant act brought hope and preserved morale as they waited for release. I join Mississippians in honoring Smitty's service to our great Nation. (2/2) https://t.co/LDk88TqHp8

Col. Carlyle "Smitty" Harris is the epitome of an American hero. His life reflected the importance of community, sacrifice, and resilience. As a prisoner of war, he taught his fellow prisoners the tap code in order to communicate with one another. (1/2)
Well said:

Coast Guard Rescue Swimmer Scott Ruskan is an American hero. He acted quickly to save 165 lives, embodying the “always ready” motto of the Coast Guard. Gayle and I thank him and everyone involved for helping during the devastating floods in Texas. https://t.co/YdXzeTjYq5
Wishing everyone a happy Independence Day! Today, we celebrate our freedoms and the men and women who have fought to secure them.

Every year, Mississippi attracts visitors from around the world, but most of our guests come from nearby states. The Mardi Gras Rail will help us welcome even more of our neighbors. This long-awaited rail line will increase tourism, boost interstate commerce, and further develop the potential of our coastal economy.

The Senate-passed reconciliation bill is an investment in the future of the United States. Through this legislation, the Senate secured a down payment on a generational upgrade for our nation’s defense capabilities. Many of the key provisions of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will be cemented and expanded. This will stimulate the economy and benefit job creators across the country. Additionally, this legislation will help secure the southern border and unleash American energy production. I encourage my colleagues in the House of Representatives to pass this bill and deliver on the promises we made to the American people in November.
President Trump's reconciliation bill needs to pass as soon as possible. Here's what would happen in Mississippi if it doesn't. https://t.co/ivUi3RrOgF

The One Big Beautiful Bill delivers the largest tax cut for families and job creators in American history. Reducing tax rates helps unleash the entrepreneurial spirit of America. I look forward to passing this legislation to strengthen our economy. https://t.co/QnWYecCoeX

Our commander-in-chief has made a deliberate —and correct— decision to eliminate the existential threat posed by the Iranian regime. We now have very serious choices ahead to provide security for our citizens and our allies and stability for the middle-east. Well-done to our military personnel. You're the best!
Mr. Putin thus proves there is no reason to expect this war criminal to negotiate in good faith or to recognize international law. https://t.co/8uVFMFuLYf

Congratulations to Commissioner Trusty on her confirmation to the @FCC! It has been my privilege to witness Olivia’s leadership over the years. She will serve the American people with excellence. https://t.co/fN5r1dMUfd

I attended the Paris Air Show to discuss building up our national industrial base and maintaining American air superiority. I also advocated to bring more economic development opportunities to Mississippi. The Magnolia State has the resources, capabilities, and business environment to produce U.S defense systems that are cutting edge.
Mississippi should keep our high school U.S. history assessment. Read my op-ed with Mary Werner, education board member, below. https://t.co/M180xKrbL7

Tonight, we stand firmly alongside Israel and its unilateral preemptive strike against Iran’s nuclear program. Iran’s sprint to become a nuclear threat to America and our allies, while leading the world in proliferating terrorism, is the cause of this conflict. The single worst decision Iran could make now is to target American service members. I’m confident General Kurilla and Secretary Hegseth have prepared our forces in the region for the threat environment they face.

President Trump is exactly right to focus on developing our U.S. small drone industrial base.

That's why @RepMikeRogersAL and I have worked together on the reconciliation bill to allocate $2B this year for small drones, a historic 20x increase in DOD's yearly level of effort.

https://t.co/okJx0omdKB

81 years ago, the historic Allied invasion of Normandy changed the course of the world. D-Day will always be remembered as the turning point of WWII. We are grateful to those who risked their lives and made the ultimate sacrifice. Their legacy lives on in the freedom we have today.

Just days after their innovative drone strike on the Russian Air Force, Ukrainians carried out another successful operation to severely damage the Kerch Bridge, a critical Russian supply line. Another victory for freedom and a blow to Putin’s illegal war effort.
The antisemitic attack that injured eight people in Colorado yesterday is appalling and indefensible. These acts of terror have no place in the United States.

Following the March tornadoes, there will be 10 recovery centers opening at 12pm today. The centers will serve 11 different counties who suffered damage. President Trump’s approval of a Major Disaster Declaration makes federal funding available to affected individuals.https://t.co/BzXWnrJR0l
Free Ukrainians just successfully devastated Russia's long range Air Force strike capabilities. War criminal Putin should learn to leave his neighbors alone.
Best of luck to the @PRCC_Baseball team as they play in the National Championship! You have made Mississippi proud, and we will be cheering you on today!
As a born and raised Mississippian, I know the Magnolia State is the best place to live, work, and raise a family. I look forward to seeing our home continue to grow. https://t.co/wa92owN2Ce

The U.S. has an abundance of LNG, which is essential for maintaining American energy dominance. The Protect LNG Act would prevent energy production from being politicized by environmental groups. Energy security is national security. https://t.co/JVbmDcP1Hi

Congratulations to the @OleMissBSB and @SouthernMissBSB on their great seasons! As Oxford and Hattiesburg host the 2025 NCAA Baseball D1 regionals, this weekend will be an exciting time for visitors to experience good food, baseball, & Southern hospitality.https://t.co/W1sOsuEMVG

On Memorial Day, Americans honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice, and so do nations around the world. Today, I am remembering a special privilege I had a few years ago. I paid my respects at the graves of Mississippi WWII veterans who were laid to rest in the American Cemetery in Luxembourg. The cemetery is a testament to the enduring gratitude our allies have for the heroism of American service members in that war.
On this Memorial Day, may we never forget those who made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our nation. https://t.co/L8s5umobpB

Gayle and I join America in mourning the two Israeli embassy staff members who were senselessly murdered last night. Antisemitism must be eradicated in the United States, and the terrorists responsible will be brought to swift justice.

The Trump admin’s recent executive order on Foreign Military Sales is exactly right and holds the promise of real generational reform.

Now, it will take hard work by @SASCGOP, our colleagues on @SenateForeign, and our departments to reimagine the fundamentals of our FMS system.

https://t.co/q6jb0YC46O

I voted to overturn a California EV mandate that would have eliminated the internal combustion engine. This was an outrageous executive overreach by Biden's EPA. Overturning this mandate will protect jobs, lower vehicle prices, and protect consumer choices.

Golden Dome will help protect our homeland and our troops deployed abroad against the threat of advanced long-range missiles from China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea.

I applaud the President for his leadership on Golden Dome, and I am proud that Congressional Republicans will make a $25 billion down payment on Golden Dome in the defense reconciliation bill. We cannot maintain deterrence without space superiority and an improved ability to conduct air and missile defense. General Guetlein has his work cut out for him, but I am confident he is the right person for the job.

I enjoyed seeing new American Idol Jamal Roberts featured on @GMA today! He is very gifted and represents the best of Mississippi. His talent, zeal, and dedication showcase the heart and soul of the Magnolia State. You have made us so proud! https://t.co/b5cT8doDYC

The U.S. must lead in AI innovation and accountability. Today, President Trump signed the Take It Down Act. This new law protects people from AI deepfakes which often target families and children. Read more about how the world is adapting to AI.https://t.co/3w0RGPUf1B

Congratulations to this year's American Idol winner, Mississippi native Jamal Roberts! Your talent and passion inspire us all. You've already made Mississippi proud, and we're excited to see all you will accomplish!
Good luck to Mississippi native Jamal Roberts as he competes in the season finale of American Idol tonight! You have made Mississippi very proud, we're rooting for you!

The committee has worked at a historic pace to advance the president’s nominees because we understand the severity of the threat environment our country faces. 

https://t.co/V71qfzX4Mm

Every single day, law enforcement personnel in Mississippi and across the nation put their lives at risk for their communities. Honoring them through #NationalPoliceWeek is an expression of gratitude for the sacrifices they make in the line of duty. I will always back the blue. https://t.co/0sGf9YOwDJ

I applaud the Trump administration for rescinding the Biden-era AI diffusion rule, which would have hurt America's competitiveness in the global AI race. Replacing the rule with a simpler, more targeted framework will protect American innovation and disrupt efforts by China to advance their AI capabilities. This is a direct threat to our national security, and I am pleased the Trump administration recognizes this urgency. https://t.co/5880zrI50X

Terrific news! American citizen Edan Alexander, who was abducted and has been held hostage by Hamas since October 7, 2023, is finally on his way home to his family. 

While we celebrate Edan’s release from captivity, I also echo his family’s call for all hostages held by Hamas to be released immediately.

The Senate passed my Congressional Review Act with @SenTimScott that brings us one step closer to overturning the burdensome NEPSHAP regulation from the Biden administration’s EPA. https://t.co/VGaXQf8oHc

Great news! @DOT has approved $171 million for transportation infrastructure projects in Mississippi. Thanks to the Trump administration, Mississippians will have safer and more updated roads and bridges. I look forward to construction on these projects starting soon.

Yesterday I met Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, the Belarusian opposition leader, to discuss her efforts to bring democracy back to her country. Lukashenko, a puppet of Putin, is an enemy of a free Belarus and democracy in the region. The U.S. stands with Tsikhanouskaya, the Belarusian people, and Lukashenko’s political prisoners as they continue to fight for freedom in Belarus.

This IG report reaffirms what I said last year: Biden’s Gaza pier was an ill-conceived, ineffective, and wasteful boondoggle that put American troops at risk and failed to deliver any meaningful assistance to civilians in Gaza. 

It’s clear the Biden administration’s decision to build the pier was driven by political calculations instead of prudent planning. Ultimately, it resulted in the loss of a young Army Sergeant, injured dozens of service members, and cost the American taxpayer $230 million – with nothing to show for it.

Nurses are essential to our nation's health care system. I introduced a resolution with @SenJeffMerkley to designate May 6th-12th as National Nurses Week as a small token of our gratitude for their service. https://t.co/FbuPrdmgnR
I am glad to see @SecDef prioritize Army MDACS development. My defense reconciliation bill with @RepMikeRogersAL will further accelerate this no-fail program in support of @POTUS' Golden Dome.

Yesterday, the world marked Israel's 77th Independence Day. Today, I spoke with Rabbi Andrew Baker, the OSCE representative on combatting anti-Semitism. We discussed his efforts to counter the rising waves of anti-Jewish sentiment following the brutal October 7th attacks. The United States will continue to stand our ally, Israel, and Jewish people around the world as they fight against hateful and violent ideologies and enemies.

Local governments need flexibility to invest in their infrastructure their constituency needs, not be stifled by bureaucratic red tape. I introduced the American Infrastructure Bonds Act, which would establish a bond program to expand investment in infrastructure improvements across the country. https://t.co/8EfA4pvjXS.

I introduced the LOCAL Infrastructure Act, which would amend the federal tax code to give more authority and financial freedom to state and local governments. Local leaders know what their communities need best. https://t.co/8KZA3qsfP7

We are 100 days into President Trump’s 2nd term. I am encouraged by the progress our country has made, especially on border security and national defense. There is much more work to do, but America is back on track!

I commend President Trump as he works toward peace in Ukraine. On Saturday, the president suggested that Putin “has to be dealt with differently.” I applaud this. 

The president has been exceedingly patient, but he is correctly stating that there should be an end.  It is time to treat Putin like the deceptive, cunning war criminal that he is.

Last week, India experienced senseless terrorism that killed many innocent civilians. I strongly condemn these attacks, and I hope those responsible are brought to justice. The U.S. stands with the people of India.

In recognition of World Malaria Day, I introduced a resolution to commend the progress made to reduce global malaria outbreaks. Fighting against malaria outbreaks through U.S. led innovation makes Americans safer and healthier at home and abroad.

The massive attacks on Kyiv once again make clear that Putin does not share President Trump's desire for peace. All along, Putin has been unwilling to work toward a lasting peace, instead choosing to continue his terror campaign against the people of Ukraine.

First, Putin sealed a “no limits” partnership with CCP dictator Xi Jinping. Next, he forged a “fiery friendship” with Kim Jong Un. This malign alliance has continued in his recent deal with the Ayatollah. 

Russia and Iran will help strengthen each other’s militaries, giving a boost to the China-led Axis of Aggressors. These tyrants will continue to threaten the American way of life until we achieve President Trump’s peace through strength agenda.

https://t.co/K9ikxbogQA

I introduced the Specialty Physicians Advancing Rural Care Act, which would create a student loan repayment program for physicians in rural areas. Many Mississippians need more access to quality health care, and this bill would help improve the physician shortage our rural communities.

Read more:
https://t.co/BtBu4afEyo

Putin’s terror campaign continues. Today, he killed dozens of civilians in a horrific Palm Sunday attack. Russia has targeted the innocent on a holy day, underscoring the depravity of its war and Putin’s continued unwillingness to work toward peace.

Last night, we kept our word to the American people and confirmed Lieutenant General Dan Caine as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. We overcame Democrats’ needless delays and finished the confirmation process overnight.

President Trump will now have the benefit of his top military advisor, and our nation will be safer for it.

Lieutenant General Caine sailed through the Senate Armed Services Committee on a 23 to 4 vote – an overwhelming, nearly unanimous, bipartisan endorsement.

We must stay as long as it takes to get @POTUS's chief military official on the job – because that is what the American people deserve and what the moment demands.

It is critical that the Senate confirm Lieutenant General Caine as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff this week. 

President @realDonaldTrump should have the expertise of the highest-ranking military officer in place without any delays.
My staff was briefed on these classified details yesterday. Who is leaking classified information to the New York Times to make @POTUS and @SecDef look bad? May need an investigation on that. 2/2

President @realDonaldTrump's strikes against the Houthis have been a success thus far. The Biden admin’s indecision and weakness allowed the Houthis to build a vast underground infrastructure. It will take time to dismantle that. This action to re-open the sea lanes will pay for itself in a matter of weeks. 1/2

https://t.co/M9rqjLBgId

The U.S. Senate has taken a significant step forward to advance @RealDonaldTrump’s agenda for border security, national defense, and tax cuts.

We have now passed a budget resolution. This is the first critical step in Congress’ funding process, allowing us to invest in homeland defense and economic prosperity – exactly the priorities Americans voted for in November.

I welcomed several senior @DeptofDefense nominees to @SASCGOP last week. My full opening statement:
https://t.co/QZJZX6cr4F

The Beltway press will try to make it seem otherwise, but it bears remembering: @PeteHegseth and I are working in lockstep to deliver on President Trump’s promise to restore peace through strength. We have a strong partnership, and that will continue. https://t.co/2XKBmY58KN

This award is a testament to the good work that Bollinger continues to do on the Polar Security Cutter program and the growing urgency with which their platforms are needed to boost our national defense. The Mississippi Gulf Coast will not only benefit from even more national security-focused quality jobs and economic development, but it will also continue to be a national player and powerhouse in mission-critical innovation and military capability.

@SASCGOP I also appreciate @PeteHegseth’s continued partnership as we both work to reform and rebuild to achieve one of President Trump’s most important promises to the American people: the restoration of peace through strength. (3/3)
As Chairman of @SASCGOP, I will always showcase Mississippi’s leading contributions for the warfighter and work to expand our state’s growing role in the defense industrial base. (2/3)

It was great to host @SecDef in Mississippi this week as we engaged with some of our state’s best-in-class defense capabilities. I am glad that the Secretary saw firsthand why our state is increasingly becoming a powerhouse in military technology and preparedness. (1/X)

The new F-47 is a fine first step in a broader effort to revitalize peace through strength. I now look forward to working with President Trump on a massive scale-up of Collaborative Combat Aircraft, supercharging B-21 bomber production, and a broad revitalization of the defense industrial base. (2/2)

Today is a great day for American airpower, and an even better day for peace and prosperity. I am delighted that President Trump has made the decision to move forward on NGAD/F-47, and I congratulate the Boeing Company. The NGAD/F-47 is a vital platform that would allow the United States to rule the skies. (1/2)

I reintroduced the Vicksburg National Military Park Boundary Modification Act, a bill aimed at expanding and modernizing the historic park. The legislation would modify the park’s boundary to allow for the construction of a state-of-the-art interpretive center, improving visitors’ experience and preserving the site’s legacy.

In Georgia, Serbia & Hungary, citizens are taking to the streets to protest corruption & authoritarianism. I stand with all those fighting for a democratic future. Leaders must respect their citizens' calls for accountability, rather than respond with Kremlin-style crackdowns.
Tornado and high wind damage all over Mississippi. Families and local government need FEMA and MEMA help quick. I'll be working this.

I applaud President Trump's decision to go on offense against the Houthis. After more than a year of terror launched on freedom of navigation, it is right that we finally allow the military to do what is required to dismantle this terrorist organization. This is what the return of peace through strength looks like.

Congratulations to the next Deputy Secretary of Defense, Stephen Feinberg. He was confirmed in a bipartisan vote, 59 to 40! In today’s extraordinary threat environment, we need a manager of the highest caliber in the role. Mr. Feinberg is up to the challenge!
As I told @TheEconomist, President Trump wants to restore peace through strength. It is time to get started. https://t.co/F1UU6eBAD4
Enjoyed sharing my thoughts on supercharging submarine production to fulfill the AUKUS agreement for this excellent @JonathanLea10 @SkyNewsAust special. https://t.co/cXLbOr3NSm

I was happy to meet the young men and women participating in the Senate Youth Program! Some of these exceptional students are from Mississippi, including Shayleen Moeini and Jackson Pearce from Gulfport! They earned a slot in this competitive program because they demonstrated commitment to community service, extracurricular activities, and their studies.

Thank you to Christine Powell and Troy Frisbie from Mississippi’s Stennis Space Center for updating me on the engine testing and certification for the Artemis mission. Winning the space race is critical to American technological supremacy and national security.

I met with John Nau, the Chairman of the American Battlefield Trust,
to discuss the Vicksburg Military Park.  I look forward to seeing progress on the restoration and preservation of this historic destination!

Tonight, President Trump outlined his vision for the next four years.  The president has already begun enforcing the law at the border and restoring our national defense. The American people voted for security and prosperity, and I look forward to achieving both over the course of President Trump’s administration.

It was good to meet with Dr. LaDon Swann of theMississippi-Alabama Sea Grant Consortium. This partnership of Jackson State, Ole Miss, the University of Southern Mississippi, and Mississippi State promotes the coastal economy and supports our domestic seafood industry.

This afternoon, I met with members of Ducks Unlimited including CEO Adam Putnam and State Chairman John Land to discuss the progress made onthe Yazoo Backwater Project.  Their organization is ready to proceed with environmental mitigation work.

Tonight I voted for the Protection of Women and Girls in Sports Act, legislation would that would prohibit any publicly funded institution from allowing a biological male to compete in women’s sports. This bill did not pass the US Senate, but I applaud the efforts by President Trump to support women and girls in sports.
Congratulations to Linda McMahon on her confirmation to be the next Secretary of Education!
Gayle and I enjoyed a beautiful walk on the Mississippi Gulf Coast. Great work from the City of Biloxi and Harrison County for their West Beach Boardwalk. https://t.co/ls4T0XryJi
It was great to see so many friends at the 2025 Gulf Coast Carnival Association Mardi Gras Royal Reception! https://t.co/dPL8hzo44g
Thank you to Biloxi Mayor Andrew “FoFo” Gilich and his wife Serena for hosting us for the 40th anniversary Krewe of Neptune Night Parade! https://t.co/ljYc5sSy3f
It is so good to be with State Rep. Missy McGee of Hattiesburg and Haley Warren, who is one of my Washington D.C. Senate Interns and serving as a 2025 Mardi Gras Maid! https://t.co/mILLKCJnd4

President Trump’s Deputy Secretary of Defense nominee Stephen Feinberg will help the Department of Defense focus on lethality, efficiency, speed, and accountability. My full opening statement from Mr. Feinberg’s confirmation hearing:

https://t.co/aNVedSEsom
The General Atomics plant in Shannon, Mississippi, is producing cutting-edge systems for our armed forces. It was good to meet with the company’s president, Scott Forney.

It was great to meet with UK Foreign Minister David Lammy last night! We discussed the US-UK “Special Alliance”, to borrow a phrase from Winston Churchill, and our shared national security priorities. https://t.co/B00frezESV

The Navy's role in our national security is more important than any moment since World War II. At exactly the worst time the service has been beset with poor management and a lack of vision. It was good to hear from President Trump’s nominee for Secretary of the Navy, John Phelan, at his hearing.

https://t.co/hnVs1XBs4J

Today, I sat down with Mark Meador, President Trump’s nominee for Federal Trade Commissioner (FTC). The FTC does important work to protect the public from deceptive or unfair business practices and unfair competition.
Kaja Kallas, the European Union High Representative, was in Washington, D.C., today. We discussed the ways Europe and the United States we can work together to support commerce and security.

I am pleased to cosponsor Senators Barrasso and Blumenthal’s Rare Disease Day resolution. This resolution designates today as National Rare Disease Day and recognizes efforts made to combat these afflictions. The measure recognizes the importance of improving awareness, encouraging accurate and early diagnosis, and supporting national and global efforts to develop effective treatments and cures.

While many in government enriched themselves at their country's expense, Boris Nemtsov fought corruption & opposed war against a peaceful neighbor. 10 years after his assassination, we stand with those brave Russians who honor his legacy by resisting Putin's murderous regime. Standing with me is Vladimir Kara-murza, Boris’ close friend.

I just finished a substantive meeting with President Trump’s Special Envoy to Ukraine and Russia, General Keith Kellogg. We discussed the security of Europe and the future of Ukraine at this pivotal moment. President Trump’s mineral deal is a great step forward! https://t.co/558YvyAlUO
It was great meeting with Canadian Members of Parliament, Randy Boissonault and Ben Carr. We discussed many topics, including border security, trade, and defense relations.
It is always good meeting with Mayor Ken Featherstone and Vice Mayor Ruben Woods of Indianola, Mississippi!

Former U.S. Army Staff Sergeant Albert Dale Waller was wounded in Vietnam in 1970. Albert never received the Purple Heart Medal that he was promised. When I heard about this oversight, I requested the medal from DOD. Yesterday, my Constituent Liaison Julian Carroll was honored to present the medal to Albert and his wife, Jane. Thank you, Albert, for your service!
Congratulations to Jamieson Greer on his confirmation to be the next United States Trade Representative!

What a great way to start the day at Mississippi Morning, our breakfast for visiting constituents!  Thank you, Lt. Col. Fred Varnado, for your beautiful rendition of God Bless America! https://t.co/c3WMoukuYA

It was great to see Haley Fisackerly, President & CEO of Entergy Mississippi. I appreciate his efforts to expand energy production in our state. Entergy is helping us meet the growing demands of our growing economy!

I was glad to support Senator Kennedy’s legislation that would overturn a misguided Biden-era regulation. We should repeal bureaucratic red-tape to promote offshore oil and gas activities on the Outer Continental Shelf. Unleash American energy dominance!
It is always good to meet with AIPAC.  Stand strong for Israel! https://t.co/yKM0je5XON

Congratulations to Dan Driscoll on his confirmation to be the next Secretary of the Army! Dan will bring relevant combat experience, a decorated military career, and a proven track record at the highest levels of law and business.
